intro: Geissanthus lepidotus, commonly known as the silverleaf geissanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence, giving it its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and prominent stamens. It is adapted to cool, humid climates and is often found in cloud forests.
